body:
I've gone looking for programs that would depend on -0.0 converting to +0.0, and (1) I can count them on my fingers and toes and (2) all their names end in _test.go.  If we were looking for a least-impact way to break compatibility, this might be it.

If we were especially paranoid about this change we could do it in two dot releases -- in one, we warn that float32(-0) and float32(-1e-1000) will convert to -0.0 in the next dot release, and in the next we change it.  The fix is trivial, and even if unfixed it's not that likely to cause problems.
